Extended

Oscillators

class maxiPolyBLEP

Anti-aliased oscillators;

Public Types

using Waveform = PolyBLEP::Waveform

Waveform types: SINE, COSINE, TRIANGLE, SQUARE, RECTANGLE, SAWTOOTH, RAMP, MODIFIED_TRIANGLE, MODIFIED_SQUARE, HALF_WAVE_RECTIFIED_SINE, FULL_WAVE_RECTIFIED_SINE, TRIANGULAR_PULSE, TRAPEZOID_FIXED, TRAPEZOID_VARIABLE

Public Functions

inline maxiPolyBLEP()

Constructor

inline double play(double freq)

play the oscillator

Parameters

freq – frequency in Hz

inline void setWaveform(Waveform waveform)

Set the waveform type

inline void setPulseWidth(double pw)

Change the pulse width (0 <= pw <= 1)

Spectral Analysis and Processing

class maxiFFT

Fast fourier transform. For spectral audio process and machine listening.

Subclassed by maxiFFTAdaptor

Public Types

enum fftModes

How to run the FFT - with or without polar conversion

Values:

enumerator NO_POLAR_CONVERSION
enumerator WITH_POLAR_CONVERSION

Public Functions

void setup(int fftSize = 1024, int hopSize = 512, int windowSize = 0)

Configure the FFT.

Parameters

  • fftSize – the FFT size. This must be a power of 2

  • hopSize – the hop size

  • windowSize – the window size

bool process(float value, fftModes mode = maxiFFT::WITH_POLAR_CONVERSION)

Analyse an audio signal with FFT

Parameters

  • value – a signal

  • mode – see fftModes enumeration

Returns

true when the analysis has run (every [hopsize] samples)

inline float *getReal()
Returns

a pointer to an array of values containing the real components of the fft analysis

inline float *getImag()
Returns

a pointer to an array of values containing the imaginary components of the fft analysis

inline std::vector<float> &getMagnitudes()
Returns

a vector of magnitudes (assuming the FFT was calcuated with polar conversion)

inline std::vector<float> &getMagnitudesDB()
Returns

a vector of magnitudes in decibels (assuming the FFT was calcuated with polar conversion)

inline std::vector<float> &getPhases()
Returns

a vector of phases (assuming the FFT was calcuated with polar conversion)

inline int getNumBins()
Returns

the number of bins in the FFT analysis

inline int getFFTSize()
Returns

the FFT size

inline int getHopSize()
Returns

the hop size

inline int getWindowSize()
Returns

the window size

float spectralFlatness()
Returns

the spectral flatness of the most recent FFT calculation

float spectralCentroid()
Returns

the spectral centroid of the most recent FFT calculation

class maxiIFFT

Inverse FFT transform

Subclassed by maxiIFFTAdaptor

Public Types

enum fftModes

Configure what kind of data is being given to the inverse FFT

Values:

enumerator SPECTRUM

Magnitudes and phases

enumerator COMPLEX

Real and imaginary components

Public Functions

void setup(int fftSize = 1024, int hopSize = 512, int windowSize = 0)

Configure the Inverse FFT.

Parameters

  • fftSize – the FFT size. This must be a power of 2

  • hopSize – the hop size

  • windowSize – the window size

float process(std::vector<float> &data1, std::vector<float> &data2, fftModes mode = maxiIFFT::SPECTRUM)

Run the inverse transform. Call this function at audio rate, but update the FFT information at FFT rate. See example 20.

Parameters

  • data1 – either magnitudes or real values

  • data2 – either phases or imaginary values

  • mode – see fftModes

Returns

the most recent sample an audio signal, creates from the inverse transform of the FFT data

inline int getNumBins()
Returns

the number of fft bins

class maxiFFTOctaveAnalyzer

An octave analyser. It takes FFT magnitudes and remaps them into pitches

Public Functions

void setup(float samplingRate, int nBandsInTheFFT, int nAveragesPerOctave)

Setup the octave analyser

Parameters

  • samplingRate – the sample rate

  • nBandsInTheFFT – the number of bins in the FFT

  • nAveragesPerOctave – how many frequency bands to split each octave into

void calculate(float *fftData)

Run the analyser

Parameters

fftData – a pointer to an array of fft magnitudes

Public Members

int nAverages

the number of averages, after analysis

float *averages

An array of averages - the energy across the pitch spectrum
